str2: An evil-spirit, demon; a heathen deity. Neuter of a derivative of daimon; a d?Monic being; by extension a deity.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Much, many; often.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Plural
str2: To cry aloud, shout, exclaim. From krauge; to clamor.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From epi and timao; to tax upon, i.e. Censure or admonish; by implication, forbid.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To allow, permit, let alone, leave. Of uncertain affinity; to let be, i.e. Permit or leave alone.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To know, remember, appreciate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
